pageContent: Objective: To characterize the clinicopathological findings and the outcome of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)-infected patients diagnosed and treated for prostate carcinoma, as HIV-positive men being treated with highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART) are living longer and thus are more likely to develop cancers such as prostate cancer.

metaData.source:
The lived experience of men diagnosed with prostate cancer
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/22940524/
